hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The closest of people to me on the Day of Resurrection will be the one who most beneficially benefits others.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Islam is built on five: testimony that there is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is His Messenger, establishing prayer, paying zakat, fasting Ramadan, and Hajj to the House.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The strength of a believer is good character and patience.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those that bring most benefit to the rest of mankind.'
The Messenger of Allah said, 'Faith increases with good manners and decreases with sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever tests Allah's patience, Allah will test him with patience.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved deeds to Allah are those that are continuous, even if they are small.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A believer is not bitten from the same hole twice.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The key to Paradise is prayer.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best prayer is the prayer of David, and the best fasting is the fasting of David.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The closest a servant is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so increase in supplication then.'
The Messenger (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Prayers are a light for the believer.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Perform prayer at its earliest time.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever prays the two cool prayers (Fajr and Asr) will enter Paradise.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The prayer is the pillar of religion.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.'
The Messenger (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Pray as you have seen me praying.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The prayer is a means of expiation for sins.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Charity does not decrease wealth. No one forgives another except that Allah increases his honor.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every act of kindness is charity.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Give charity without delay, for it stands in the way of calamity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that which is given when one is rich.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Save yourself from hellfire even by giving half a date in charity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that given in Ramadan.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Charity does not decrease wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The charity given to a poor person is a charity, and if he accepts it, it is a good deed for the giver.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every Muslim is a brother to every Muslim, and it is unlawful for a Muslim to forsake his brother.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that given when one is in good health, and wealthy.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is at the first stroke of a calamity.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'No one is given a gift better and more comprehensive than patience.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The strong is not the one who overcomes the people by his strength, but the strong is the one who controls himself while in anger.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is a light.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Verily, with hardship comes ease.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is a virtue and a sign of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is patient and forgiving, Allah will reward him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience and prayer are the best remedies for the believer.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who bears patiently whatever afflicts him will have his patience rewarded.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is light, and Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not thank people does not thank Allah.'

The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Look at those below you (less fortunate) and do not look at those above you, for this is more suitable to prevent you from neglecting Allah's blessings.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever is not grateful for small favors, he will not be grateful for large ones.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is not grateful for the favors of Allah is not grateful to Allah.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those most beneficial to others.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Eat and drink, be grateful, and increase in charity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of deeds to Allah is gratitude.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is not grateful for Allah's favors is not grateful to Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Thankfulness increases sustenance.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Thankfulness for Allah's blessings is a sign of His love.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is kind and loves kindness. He grants for kindness what He does not grant for harshness.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is pleased with kindness and kindnessing others.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Be kind to your children and be generous to your neighbors.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is not merciful to people, Allah will not be merciful to him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Kindness and mercy are the foundation of all good deeds.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'God is Merciful and loves mercy; He grants for mercy what He does not grant for harshness.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Show mercy to those on the earth, and the One above the heavens will show mercy to you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those with the most beneficial kindness.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The kindest of people towards the believers is the one who is most beneficial.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is kind and loves kindness in all matters.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and seeking reward, will have his past sins forgiven.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield from the fire and from sins.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting and the Quran will intercede for the servant on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The fast is a shield from the fire.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fast in the month of Ramadan, and then there are six days of Shawwal, and it will be as if you fasted for a lifetime.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is half of patience.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield from the Hellfire.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield and protection for the believer.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting and prayer are the two pillars of Islam.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield from the fire and the sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit sin or dispute unjustly, he will come out as free from sin as the day his mother bore him.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Perform Hajj and Umrah consecutively, for they remove poverty and sins as the bellows remove impurities from iron.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The reward for Hajj accepted by Allah is Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj properly, without committing any evil or wickedness, will return free from sins.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Hajj is the best deed.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit any evil, his sins will be forgiven.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Hajj is the most virtuous of deeds.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Hajj and Umrah remove poverty and sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj for Allah's pleasure and does not commit sin, he will return free from sin.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of deeds is Hajj.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The honest merchant will be with the prophets, the truthful, and the martyrs.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Beware of dishonesty, for it leads to the Hellfire.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Truthfulness leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A truthful merchant will be with the prophets and the truthful.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who is most beneficial.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Honesty leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those who are most honest.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Honesty is a sign of faith, and lying is a sign of hypocrisy.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Truthfulness guides to righteousness.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Be honest, for honesty leads to righteousness.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever forgives and makes reconciliation, his reward is with Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among people are those who forgive others.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'If anyone shows patience and forgives, that is among the great acts of courage.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'When a person forgives and makes reconciliation, Allah will elevate his status.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who forgives others is loved by Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Forgiveness is the best act of charity.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah loves those who forgive.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever forgives and makes peace, his reward is with Allah.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among people are those who forgive easily.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Forgiveness is a sign of strength.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The pleasure of Allah lies in the pleasure of the parents, and the anger of Allah lies in the anger of the parents.'

A man asked the Prophet, 'O Messenger of Allah, who is the most deserving of my good companionship?' He said, 'Your mother.' The man asked, 'Then who?' He said, 'Your mother.' The man asked again, 'Then who?' He said, 'Your mother.' The man asked once more, 'Then who?' He said, 'Your father.'
A man asked the Prophet, 'O Messenger of Allah, what are the rights of parents over their children?' The Prophet said, 'They are your paradise or your hell.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A sonâ€™s good deeds are not accepted if he does not fulfill the rights of his parents.'
The Prophet said, 'Respect your parents and be good to them, for Paradise lies at their feet.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not show mercy to people, Allah will not show mercy to him.'
A man asked the Prophet about the best deeds. He replied, 'To be kind and dutiful to your mother.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Your mother, then your mother, then your mother, then your father.'
The Prophet said, 'Allah has cursed those women who imitate men and those men who imitate women.'
A man asked the Prophet, 'What is the best deed?' He said, 'To be good to your parents.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A child is a gift from Allah, and it is a duty to treat children kindly and with justice.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of you are those who are best to their children.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not show mercy to our little ones and respect to our elders is not one of us.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Children are a blessing and a trust from Allah.'
The Prophet said, 'Every child is born in a state of fitrah (natural disposition) and it is the parents who make him a Jew, Christian, or Magian.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A child's prayer is accepted if he prays with sincerity.'
The Prophet said, 'Treat your children kindly and teach them good manners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) emphasized kindness to children and said, 'He who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy.'
The Prophet said, 'A child's happiness lies in being loved and well cared for.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A child who is loved and nurtured properly will be a source of pride in this world and the Hereafter.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Marriage is my Sunnah; whoever does not follow my Sunnah has nothing to do with me.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Marry loving and fertile women, for I will boast of your great numbers before the other nations on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most perfect of believers in faith are those best in character, and the best of you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A woman is married for four reasons: her wealth, her lineage, her beauty, and her piety. Choose the pious, and you will be successful.'
The Prophet said, 'When a man marries, he has completed half of his faith; so let him fear Allah regarding the remaining half.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A woman is married for four reasons: her wealth, her lineage, her beauty, and her piety. So, marry a pious woman.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Marry those who are loving and fertile, for I will boast of your great numbers before the other nations.'
The Prophet said, 'The best among you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his neighbor.'
The Prophet said, 'The neighbor of a Muslim should not harm him, nor should he oppress him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him be good to his neighbor.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among people are those with the best manners and the most beneficial to their neighbors.'
The Prophet said, 'Your neighbor has rights over you, including not harming him and helping him in times of need.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his neighbor.'
The Prophet said, 'A Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hands other Muslims are safe.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who has a good neighbor has a good life.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best neighbor is the one who is most beneficial to his neighbor.'
The Prophet said, 'Help your neighbor whether he is an oppressor or he is oppressed.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A Muslim is the brother of another Muslim; he should not oppress him, nor should he abandon him.'
The Prophet said, 'The believers are like one body; if one part aches, the whole body suffers.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those most beneficial to others.'
The Prophet said, 'Help your brother whether he is an oppressor or oppressed.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A believer to another believer is like a building, each part strengthening the other.'
The Prophet said, 'The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, but both are good.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who are best to their brothers.'

The Prophet said, 'Help your brother whether he is an oppressor or oppressed. If he is an oppressor, help him by preventing him from oppressing others; if he is oppressed, help him by supporting him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A believer is a mirror to his brother.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of people are those with the best character and manners towards their brothers.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty is part of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every religion has its high moral; the high moral of Islam is modesty.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty and faith are inseparable; if one is taken away, the other is also gone.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty does not bring anything except goodness.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty is a branch of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is modest, Allah will enrich him.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty and faith are two companions; if one is taken away, the other is also gone.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) emphasized, 'Modesty is among the good manners.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty does not prevent anything but enhances good.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty and faith go hand in hand; when one of them is lost, the other is lost too.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is more pleased with the repentance of His servant than a person who finds his lost camel in the desert.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every son of Adam sins, and the best of sinners are those who repent.'
The Prophet said, 'Repent to Allah, for I repent a hundred times a day.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever repents before sunrise from his sins is like one who has no sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah forgives all sins of those who turn to Him in repentance.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of those who seek forgiveness are those who sincerely repent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Turn to Allah in repentance, for He loves those who repent.'
The Prophet said, 'Seek Allahâ€™s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The door of repentance is open until the sun rises from the west.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is merciful and loves mercy.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Show mercy to others, and Allah will have mercy upon you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allahâ€™s mercy encompasses everything; therefore, show mercy to those on the earth.'
The Prophet said, 'Allahâ€™s mercy is greater than any anger.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is more merciful to His servants than a mother is to her child.'
The Prophet said, 'Be merciful to those on the earth, and the One above the heavens will have mercy upon you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allahâ€™s mercy surpasses His wrath.'
The Prophet said, 'Allahâ€™s mercy is near to those who do good.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allahâ€™s mercy is more extensive than His punishment.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Show mercy and forgive, for Allah will forgive you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Humility is a sign of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who humbles himself for the sake of Allah, Allah will raise him in status.'
The Prophet said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who is most beneficial and humble.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Humility does not diminish your honor but increases your dignity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is with those who are humble.'
The Prophet said, 'Humility is a part of faith and a sign of sincerity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who humbles himself for Allahâ€™s sake, Allah will elevate him.'
The Prophet said, 'Humility is the way to Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The humble are exalted in the sight of Allah.'
The Prophet said, 'Humility is a characteristic of the righteous.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Beware of envy, for it consumes good deeds as fire consumes wood.'
The Prophet said, 'Do not envy one another, nor compete with one another, but be servants of Allah as brothers.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy destroys good deeds like fire destroys wood.'
The Prophet warned against envy and said, 'It consumes faith and good deeds.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy is forbidden except in two cases: a person whom Allah has given wealth and he spends it righteously, and a person whom Allah has given wisdom and he acts upon it and teaches it.'
The Prophet said, 'Do not envy each other, but seek Allahâ€™s favor and blessings.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy consumes good deeds as fire consumes wood or grass.'
The Prophet warned, 'Beware of envy, for it destroys faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy is a trait of the hypocrites; avoid it.'
The Prophet said, 'Envy destroys good deeds as fire destroys wood.'
